poem:
Title: "Unfulfilled Promises"

Gaza waits, a hungry heart
under the stern gaze of statehood.
Promises linger, spectral echoes,
of false dawns and absent aid.
The trucks stand silent, their cargo,
a farce of plenty subscribed by the guilty.
Gaza waits, so does famine,
an intimate acquaintance of despair.
Thanks, we were promised, in abundance.
Instead, we reap dust and despair.
Only famine remains faithful in Gaza.
